name: Age of Fear 2: The Chaos Lord GOLD
description: Play as either Bel'Kara, a seductive Succubus at odds with the Underworld, or Katzok, a brutal Orc Chieftan fighting for his clan's dominance. The Age of Fear series is a deep and complex turn-based strategy (full of humour!) that fuses a tabletop wargame with RPG elements.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP Processor: 1 GHz Memory: 1 GB RAM Storage: 5 GB available space

reviews.review_text: Update Dec. 2 2015:  According to Les, a developer of AOFs (I myself have not looked closely into the game yet but will do), he has worked on balance issues I mentioned. He buffed giant spiders and nerfed Remove Chaos Magic.   The Good

i havent played it as much as the first one, but i can safely recomend it. and besides the dev is constantly updating the game. it is updated more frequently than any other game in my library. the creator really seems to be puting his soul in this game, and it´s working. what a hidden pearl. i consider it more a visual novel than an adventure, but with really deep tactics and character development, beautiful soundtrack, enthralling storyline in all campaigns i´ve played.(there are 2 in each game). dont forget to update your sound drivers or the game will freeze

Same as with AoF1, this game delivers what it promises, and does it very well too. The developers are constantly updating the game, and adding content or touching balance every week, proving they love their creation.  For those who didn't read my review on the first game, this one also plays a lot like a Warhammer game, there are no hexagons, you move according to the distance each unit can move. The units you take with you to the battle gain experience and when they level up, get new skills.  The game is cheap as is, so I didn't mind paying the full price. It's worth it. You get two full campaigns with lots of units and abilities to try, in a hard game. :)  If you like tactical games, this one is (same as the first one) one of the best there are this days around. :)

Age of Fear 2 is a refreshingly fun strategy title that marries a tabletop wargame with elements of role-playing. Despite its depth, Age of Fear has a perfectly intuitive interface that makes learning the ropes a simple endeavor. The turn structure and combat mechanics make sense immediately, and the joy of leveling your troops and upgrading their skills remains engaging throughout the campaigns. Though a little too pricey, the fact is that this is a very solid title for anyone that likes strategy games set in a fantasy universe.

A pretty cool Tactical RPG experience. The stories have a nice kind of grit to it, making the right decisions in skirmishes does pay off, and there's a great variety of units considering the length of the campaigns.  TBH the price point is a bit high, but if you're an old school lover of the genre this is a good pick.

So ok I bought this game solely on the awesome reply from the dev. That being said I gave this a thumbs down because the linux version just plainly doesn't work. I got through the 1st mission (tutorial) with just one freeze. After that the game froze on me again and loading autosaves just doesn't work. Loading savegames just freezes the game.  Really, the linux/steamos -version needs some work. But guess I'll give it a go on a win10.

I hate misleading tags. Walls of texts making a story are not an rpg. And this is defenitly not an adventure game... there is no exploring.  its an arena style combat game, which might be good, i will never know. i requested a refund because i refuse to support developers who mistag their games to mislead players into buying.
A sadly dated game. Mainly a text based storey.

Interesting story and game altogether. There's a bunch of reading that you gotta do (or not) while playing this game. The play style is kinda unique but I've seen it in f2p flash games online. I'd rate this game 8/10.

Story pages take you through the plot, which plays out as a series of turn-based battles where you can miss 90% attacks 5 times in a row. Chance is opposite to strategy, and I never end up playing more than 20 minutes due to the bull-bull. Still a charming game.
